meanings.definition: The practices or principles of the Jesuits, especially casuistry or equivocation.
meanings.sent1: The jesuitism of the group led to confusion among the members.
meanings.sent2: His adherence to jesuitism made him a respected member of the order.
meanings.sent3: The jesuitism in their decision-making process sometimes resulted in unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent4: Her use of jesuitism in negotiations allowed her to navigate tricky situations smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The jesuitism of the politician was evident in his carefully worded statements.

meanings.definition: The characteristic practices or principles of the Jesuits.
meanings.sent1: The jesuitism of the school emphasized education and service.
meanings.sent2: Their dedication to jesuitism guided their daily actions.
meanings.sent3: The jesuitism of the chef was evident in the precision of his culinary techniques.
meanings.sent4: In her artwork, she incorporated elements of jesuitism to convey deep meaning.
meanings.sent5: The jesuitism of the team fostered a strong sense of community among its members.
